authors: Marcel Good, Ward Bell, Rob Eisenberg
description: Cocktail leverages established patterns and approaches, such as MVVM und builds on DevForce 2010 rich data service capabilities.
releaseNotes:
- New: Generic OperationResult<T> class for returning result values from asynchronous operations.
      - New: Additional AsOperationResult extension methods for the various DevForce operations.
      - Breaking change: Enhanced DialogManager to support a default button, enter and ESC keys (Method signature change).
      - New: Improved look and feel of DialogManager for WPF.
      - Fix: Threading issue during asynchronous bootstrapping in WPF.
      - Fix: Duplicate log output if DevForces fails to create log file.
      - New: Seperate solutions to build Cocktail for WPF, Silerlight 4 and Silverlight 5 only.
      - New: WPF version of TempHire
      - Enhancements to TempHire.
      - Minor code cleanup and optimizations.
summary: Cocktail is an application development platform that takes the pain out of the development of data-driven Rich Internet Applications (RIA) in Silverlight or WPF Desktop Applications.
